>
>
>May be there are some different.
>In unit test phase we use junit test our fucntion of class, and not put 
>class in real env such like tomcat...


Yes, but to get to a point where we can unit test it we may need to put it 
in a "real" environment.


>In integration test we put our project into real env and process 
>intergration test.

Integration is more black box, at least to my way of thinking. (Which may 
be coloured by the large lunch I just had, I admit...)

>I do not know is it right of my unstand about it.
>Another quesiton about cactus is if part of our class finished, can we use 
>it process unit test? Such like a website, login process not finished and 
>register funciton have done, can I test register function?


That would depend on the architecture - for example, usually you would have 
a servlet and a couple of beans, helper classes etc. Unit testing via Junit 
could be done on the beans and helper classes, while you would want cactus 
(for example) to test the servlet. Testing the form/html servlet response 
would be better done with something like HttpUnit.





>Sorry for my poor english :)

Better that my... German, is it?


Jim
